item.description: Registering a new domain for a new podcast I‚Äôm doing with Jaimie. It‚Äôs going to be massively fun.

item.description: Watching a movie with little kids is fascinating‚Äînot least, in teaching them what to feel in response to what happens on the screen.

item.description: Crockpot meals on cold days when you‚Äôre solo-parenting are the best.

item.description: An important elaboration on my productivity this week: 30 hours under those circumstances is a bit more notable when you remember that Monday was a holiday. üòú
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description:
Managed 30 hours of work this week and maintained Inbox Zero and OmniFocus Zero.

Decent start to the year.

Especially given I‚Äôve been parenting solo since Wednesday, what with my wife being out of town. :wide, slightly frantic eyes: (My little girls have been amazing, actually.)
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 6 of 6
item.description: Some big goals for 2017, and some smaller ones too.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 5 of 6
item.description: My strategy for productivity: less social media, careful use of my time, and embracing the "pomodoro technique".
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 4 of 6
item.description: Olo is great; I helped build (almost from scratch) a large mobile web application; I did some open-source software; it was a good year professionally.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 3 of 6
item.description: On top of my 200,000 words of writing this year, I also published some 66 episodes and almost 20 hours of podcasting across four different shows.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 2 of 6
item.description: One of my goals for 2016 was to continue writing not only on this blog but in other outlets. I did a *lot* of writing this year, but relatively little of it is published. But here's a look at some of the numbers! (And they are large!)
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Part 1 of 6
item.description: Accidental 20-mile runs, walking pneumonia, gaining weight because of metabolic shifts, and other adventures in my "fitness" in 2016.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: 2016 in Review, Introduction
item.description: 2016 was a long, difficult, strange, sometimes wonderful and sometimes dreadful year for me. It was one of the most professionally and scholastically enjoyable and rewarding years of my life, and also one of the most exhausting. As I often do at years-end, I am taking stock publicly of what went well, what went poorly, and what I might do different in a variety of categories!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Perspective on a mother, by a four-year-old child.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: My 4-year-old is in her room by herself during her rest time‚Ä¶ reciting the first question and answer from the Heidelberg Catechism. #winning
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: I have busted out the scary dad voice twice already this morning. Could be a long day. (Pushing is not allowed. Neither is disobeying mommy and screaming at her.)
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: A Simple Children's Catechism
item.description: The simple catechism we use with our girls‚Äîthere‚Äôs nothing original here except perhaps the specific form and order. But I hope someone finds it useful! The aim is deep answers that are easy for little kids to remember and to say.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: We‚Äôre sitting here with a friend, talking about two‚Äôs complement representation of negative numbers in binary. We are nerds, people.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: I think our day trip to the beach was a success. At dinner, Ellie said, ‚ÄúThis was the best day ever!‚Äù
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Astounding as it is to be able to work from the middle of a bus in the sky‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm ready to be home, for so many reasons. Working in my own office again will be nice. Having my sweet little girls come say hello while I‚Äôm working will ‚Ä¶

item.description: Heard in our house tonight: ‚ÄúNo, Kate, why are you putting spinach on your toes?!‚Äù

item.description:
One of the reasons we meet together as a church every Sunday, no matter what; and one of the beauties of taking the Lord‚Äôs supper together every Sunday, no matter what, is this:

Today, my morning so far has involved one child being mildly fussy, and the other having ‚Ä¶

item.description: Eventually, my daughters are going to discover that I am not, in fact, cool. I‚Äôm going to enjoy it as long as it lasts.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: My wife has a voice made for podcasting. I‚Äôm editing the newest episode of Sap.py (!) and listening to her speak is simply sublime.

Ellie: ‚ÄúYeah, then I‚Äôll be ready for kindergarten!

‚Äú‚Ä¶ What‚Äôs kindergarten?‚Äù

item.description: I am increasingly persuaded that there is a law of the universe which states: On any morning in which parents intend to sleep in at all, their children will awaken early, and with an overabundance of energy.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Parenting skills: seeing the projectile vomit beginning, and sidestepping so it only gets on the floor.

item.description: Jaimie put on a recording of ‚ÄúAll I Have is Christ.‚Äù And Ellie is singing along. I think my brain might explode from the wonderfulness.

item.title: Thoughts on 2015 (and 2016)
item.description: As we come to the end of the year, I have been reflecting on the things I set out to do this year, and on my hopes for the coming year. At the start of the year, I posted a number of goals for my ‚Äúpublic‚Äù life this year, and ‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Ellie has invented her first totally-original (as opposed to borrowed from a TV show) imaginary friend. Her name, apparently, is ‚ÄúBallerina‚Äù.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: This week Kate learned to walk. Also, she decided to go on a goldfish-and-hotdogs-only food strike, and to wake up at 11pm and cry, shout, and scream for over an hour multiple nights this week. You win some, you lose some?
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Ellie and Kate consistently get up half an hour to an hour earlier on Saturday mornings than any other day of the week. Coincidentally‚Äîor is it?‚ÄîSaturday is also the only day we try to sleep in. It‚Äôs like they know, and plot against us!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: A minute ago, Ellie asked me to play with her and Kate. I started to answer, ‚ÄúNo, I need to finish publishing Winning Slowly.‚Äù Then I remembered: putting that first would be pretty much exactly the opposite of Winning Slowly.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: Faithfulness
item.description:
It‚Äôs been a lot more than a month since the promised monthly update. I‚Äôll blame it on a lack of self-discipline‚Ä¶ or perhaps on the presence thereof.

Every day, we face choices about where to spend our time. In this particular season of life, that has often meant ‚Ä¶

item.description: Our youngest has been sleeping through the night for a week now. Going to bed at 9:45 & getting up at 5:15 is suddenly doable again. Huzzah!

item.title: Snow Days and Friends Moving
item.description:
Another month gone, another bunch of little changes, and a few bigger changes, too.

February marked the final burst of winter here. We had a number of days of wintry weather, leading to several days where Southeastern‚Äôs campus was closed‚Äîthough none on days when I had class! One ‚Ä¶

item.title: The State of Our Family in Early 2015
item.description: It has been a long time since I wrote a family update here, and I skipped the Christmas letter this year because I was exhausted. I resolved at the beginning of the year to write at least one update every month, though. I want these updates here for myself, if ‚Ä¶

item.title: Whiplash
item.description: Get a big contract—jubilation! Watch your daughter almost choke to death—terror!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: The Long Race
item.description: It has been too long since I have written anything‚Äîtoo long not for my audience (small as it is), but for my soul. The last few weeks of class were of course even busier than the rest of the semester, courtesy of a couple major assignments I wrapped up ‚Ä¶

item.title: Spinning!
item.description: As she so often does, Ellie simply delighted me tonight, in two wonderful moments—both of which involved spinning to classical music.
